photo.description: Aghios Stilianos, a small chapel on Santorini, stands in great contrast to many of its Byzantine neighbours. The peach exterior makes it stand out from afar, as of course does its size. There are also a wonderfully ornate clock tower within which are also bells. The inside is just as decorative with large religious portraits framed with pillars. The dome from the interior is lilac blue and other parts are colored orange and cream. Look out for the confession box by the door. One can also tell that the cathedral is not that old and was in fact restored and opened in 1975 after suffering from the earthquake of the fifties.

photo.description: Enjoy my art? Visit the Shane Gorski Photography Store and enjoy it in print! View On Black HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR DRAMATIC EFFECT Shot taken at St. John's Armenian Church in Southfield, Michigan. I've gone to school in Southfield for five years and I knew nothing about this building till about two days ago. It's tucked away around Northwestern and 9 Mile Road. All you can really see is a little bit of its roof and cross on top. You would never think something so beautiful could be in Southfield. Textures taken from an oil painting my fiancee bought during a trip to the Greek island of Santorini.

photo.description: On August 15, 2007 I uploaded my first photo to Flickr. That means it's been a year already! Now it's time to remember all the fun and beautiful moments of my past flickring. I hope I'll be able to keep learning and improving with each picture I take through this second year. I'd also like to thank my contacts and Flickr friends. You and your wonderful photos make my Flickr experience infinite times more interesting and fun! =) * El 15 d'agost de 2007 vaig penjar la meva primera foto a Flickr. I això vol dir que ja ha passat un any! Ara toca recordar tots els moments bonics i divertits que he passat flickrejant. Espero que podré seguir aprenent i millorant amb cada foto que faci durant aquest segon any. També vull donar les gràcies a tots els meus contactes i amics de Flickr. Vosaltres i les vostres magnífiques fotos feu que la meva experiència a Flickr sigui infinitament més interessant i divertida! =) 1. Neon Cross, 2. The night I found you, 3. Agbar Tower (detail), 4. Urban magic (rain & lights), 5. Ready to fly (II), 6. Ivy, 7. Sailing in a blue dream, 8. MACBA (XV) - Whole lotta holes!, 9. Breaking the ice, 10. Sunrise, 11. Night life, 12. Herengracht at dawn, 13. Wooden tulips, 14. A walk in the rain, 15. Christmas bokeh!, 16. Rokin night lights, 17. Night falls over Athens, 18. A storm is coming..., 19. Sainte-Chapelle (I), 20. photo.description: The architectural style of Santorini is unique in the Greek islands and the reason for that is that all houses have been build with anti-seismic construction. The churches though keep the traditional Cycladic style with the blue domes. The white is the dominant colour following by the blue and less by the pink and the ochre that is something relatively new in the traditional painting of Greek island houses. In the following pictures you can get an idea about the architectural style of Santorini.
photo.tags: greece seascape landscape santorini oia nikon d90 nikond90
photo.title: Oia - Santorini

photo.description: Buildings in the Greek Cycladic islands, including Santorini (Thira), were traditionally painted white to reflect the harsh summer sun. From 1967 to 1974, Greece's military government mandated that all new buildings on the islands were to be painted white to reflect political solidarity. Though this expectation is no longer politically enforced, the tourism industry encourages its continuance. Coupled with the traditional blue dome of most churches, this has led to the almost stereotypical white and blue landscape of the island.
photo.title: Greece-8.jpg

photo.description: On August 15, 2007 I uploaded my first photo to Flickr. That means yesterday was my 2nd Flickrversary! During this last year I've been uploading photos mostly of my trips to the Greek Islands and (more recently) Rome, but also some photos from photowalks around Barcelona or day trips to Girona, Montblanc and other places in Catalonia. Due to work, I can't always dedicate as much time to Flickring as I'd like, but I hope I still managed to learn and improve somewhat. There's still many photos of Rome, Greece, France or even Finland waiting to be uploaded to my photostream, and I hope I'll be travelling again (which means more photos - yay!) soon... There's also much of my hometown, Barcelona, I want to share with all of you! I would like to thank all my Flickr friends for taking the time to view and comment my photos and for sharing your wonderful art. It is thanks to you that this continues to be a truly rewarding learning experience! 1. Church in Oia, Santorini (Greece), 2. The dungeon, 3. An evening in Rethymno, 4. Stairway in Oia, Santorini, 5. Paraportiani Church, Mykonos, 6. Santorini sunset, 7. Brettos (II), 8. Another summer night falls over Oia, 9. Greek Minimalism (III), 10. Dreaming of the sea, 11. Santorini Blues, 12. A beautiful summer story..., 13. Relaxing in Santorini, 14. A dream in blue and white, 15. Ammoudi, 16. A rainy day in Girona, 17. Pujada de Sant Domènec, 18. Oia Sunset, 19. The Colosseum at night (I), 20. From the Dome of St. Peter's Basilica, 21. Night walk in St. Peter's Square, 22. Fontana Di Trevi, 23. Castel Sant'Angelo, 24. Capitoline Sunset, 25. Life spins ever faster
photo.title: My 2nd Flickrversary!
